channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA

item.title: Report X-2025010117
item.description:
Report X-2025010117

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-08T18:17:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-19
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER REPORTED TO DOOR 3 IN THE UNLOAD. WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUID. THE BOX WAS ON THE FLOOR. BOX WAS WET ON SIDE. NO LIQUID ON THE FLOOR NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025010068
item.description:
Report E-2025010068

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-03
  • City: BENSALEM
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding one leaking 55-gallon DM containing hazardous product, RDL44LVOC. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 1-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 2’ x 3’ area as a result of improper packaging. Oil dry was applied to the release and the damaged, leaking drum was overpacked. Two drums were generated container the overpacked drum of product, the impacted oil dry and the impacted PPE. XPO will manage all waste generated from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.
